More info needed:
Which version? Which operating system? Did you do anything special before it started happening?

Bitcoin version 0.8.5
Windows 7 64-bit

It happen after reverted back to older AMD graphic drivers at least CCC 11.1 and OpenCL 2.5. There is a possibility my system may have cause this. I will do a reformat and get back to you when the problem is the same. Thanks.

No such drastic measures may be needed.
It may be that it somehow stored off-screen coordinates and is trying to restore the GUI to there.
Can you try removing the registry keys of Bitcoin? (don't know what the path is, but the last position of the window is stored in there)
@diapolo do you maybe know?
@laanwj could you please point me to the correct registry so I can check it out.
I don't know what that is, can you do a search for Bitcoin-Qt?

How Windows NT Saves Window Size and Location Parameters:
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/235994

easy way would be to login with a new user
Start regedit and go to HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Bitcoin\Bitcoin-Qt and delete ``nWindowPos`` and ``nWindowSize``, while the client is NOT running!

Thanks @Diapolo. That fix it!
Here was the data before I deleted it:
nWindowPos REG_SZ @Point(-1025 114)
nWindowSize REG_SZ @Size(796 550)

Thanks for letting us know @edden87 
We could be more careful when restoring the window position. I had this problem with Winzip (I think) in the past and it was very frustrating.
@laanwj Perhaps we could add a check, if the dimensions are negative and just reject such values and use defaults then.
